intro: Lourteigia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf lourteigia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
